value.title: Secure your cloud data
value.excerpt: This learning path helps you leverage the built-in Azure services for securing app data, ensuring that only authorized services and clients have access.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

topItems.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the Site Reliability Engineering approach to the challenge of assuring reliability and gain a better understanding of why it matters.

topItems.title: Configure security policies to manage data
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to set up policies to classify, retain, and protect your cloud-based data.

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data with access keys, secure networks, and Advanced Threat Protection monitoring.

value.title: Architect a data platform in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect a data platform in Azure and build solutions to store relational and NoSQL data.

topItems.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure data storage options
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll explore the benefits of Azure data storage services versus on-premises storage.

topItems.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data
topItems.excerpt: Find out what makes Azure SQL Database a good choice for your relational database, how to create the database from the portal and connect with Azure Cloud Shell.

topItems.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 2: Describe core Azure services
value.excerpt: This learning path provides you with an introduction to the basics of Azure's core services for compute, network, storage, and database.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Explore Azure database and analytics services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the database services that are available on Microsoft Azure, such as Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Azure Database for MySQL, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, as well as big data and analytics.

topItems.title: Explore Azure compute services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different services that are available in Azure Compute.

topItems.title: Explore Azure Storage services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different storage options that are available in Azure Storage.

value.title: Connect your services together
value.excerpt: Use Azure to create website front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that compute-on-demand and can also communicate with each other.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

topItems.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to write code in .NET applications using Azure Service Bus for communications that can handle high demand, low bandwidth, and hardware failures.

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use Azure Event Hubs to reliably process high-volume data streams to enable you to code applications to send and receive messages through the hub.

value.title: Architect message brokering and serverless applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to create reliable messaging for your applications, and how to take advantage of serverless application services in Azure.

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow you to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning server infrastructure

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to define a workflow to run your business with Logic apps using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

value.title: How to query Azure Storage logs in Azure Monitor Log Analytics | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to upload and analyze Azure Storage logs with Azure Monitor Log Analytics.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips     Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft

value.title: Design a data warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a data warehouse in Azure Synapse Analytics in minutes to take advantage of massively parallel processing (MPP) and run complex queries at petabyte scale quickly

value.title: Azure Data Fundamentals: Explore modern data warehouse analytics in Azure
value.excerpt: Azure Data Fundamentals: Explore modern data warehouse analytics in Azure

topItems.title: Examine components of a modern data warehouse

value.title: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Streaming Analytics
value.excerpt: In this learning path, discover Azure Stream Analytics streaming data, the concepts of event processing, and integration of Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

topItems.title: Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore how Azure Stream Analytics integrates with your applications or Internet of Things devices to gain insights with real-time streaming data.

topItems.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure Stream Analytics jobs to process input data, transform it with a query, and return results

value.title: Implement a Data Warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Azure Synapse Analytics provides a relational big data store that can scale to Petabytes of data. In this learning path, you will learn how Azure Synapse Analytics can achieve this scale with its Massively Parallel Processing (MPP) architecture. Create a data warehouse in minutes and use familiar querying language to build reports. Load massive amounts of data in minutes, and ensure that your data warehouse is secure.

topItems.title: Design a data warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create a data warehouse in Azure Synapse Analytics in minutes to take advantage of massively parallel processing (MPP) and run complex queries at petabyte scale quickly

topItems.title: Query data in Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to issue simple queries against Azure Synapse Analytics and how to visualize the data in both Excel and Power BI

topItems.title: Import data into Azure Synapse Analytics by using PolyBase
topItems.excerpt: Load petabytes of data into an Azure Synapse Analytics database in minutes by using PolyBase

value.title: Build and query a Delta Lake
value.excerpt: Build and query a Delta Lake

value.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
value.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

value.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the Text Analytics API and Azure Functions to discover what your customers are really saying in their feedback about your products or brands.

value.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
value.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from your previously completed "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you controlled a refrigerated truck. Here, in this module, you add continuous data export to both Azure Blob storage and an event hub. You then build a Power BI app to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

value.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

value.title: Describe lazy evaluation and other performance features in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Describe lazy evaluation and other performance features in Azure Databricks

value.title: Detect language with the text analytics API
value.excerpt: Language detection is useful for content stores that collect arbitrary text, where language is unknown. You can parse the results of this analysis to determine which language is used in the input document.

value.title: Recognize entities in text with the text analytics API
value.excerpt: Identify and categorize entities in your text as people, places, organizations, date/time, quantities, percentages, currencies, and more.
